data.title: Like Pizzahut but this was disappointing.
data.text: This location was not as good as the other locations that I have used. Pan pizza was salty and plain crust, no flavor like the other locations. Ordered buffalo wings - medium heat, they were not good, over cooked and not spicy. I seriously think they messed up on that. Also ordered the cheesie bread breadsticks which only had cheese and no flavor and overall the food was warm not hot, I am 3 miles from this location therefore it shouldn't have gotten warm in less than a 15 minute drive from store to hotel. Compared to other locations, this one almost turned me off of Pizzahut.

data.title: Not what we ordered, good delivery person, manager on phone said she would apply credit.
data.text: While at my sister's one night because I was visiting from out-of-state we decided not to go out & we ordered Pizza that apparently she does fairly often from Pizza Hut.  Yes, it was delivered fast, but ordering on the phone was a nightmare!  The young woman either did not listen, was too busy or who knows but my sister had to repeat at least 10 times simple information.  Later we talked about how it took longer to order than it did to have the food delivered!  Two pizzas that were wrong & dry because we had asked for extra sauce & it was not on them.  Also the types we ordered we not right, we had asked for one meat lovers, but never got it.  We also ordered bread sticks that we never opened, but seemed basic & o.k.  There was a $2.99 Delivery Charge because I guess some folks don't have brains enough to tip, we did anyway on top of this because I am not certain if the delivery driver actually gets it???  I called the manager who apparently was the same person who took the order according to the slip & she did offer to get us out another order, but we declined & she did say she would apply a credit to my sister's account.  We'll see.  Obviously a busy location with confusion of orders, so be careful.  Just barely O.K.

data.title: Delivery to room
data.text: We ordered pizza delivery cause we just didn't feel like getting out of our hotel after working. We used the app and customized everything in our order. It arrived on time and everything was customized perfectly. Very fresh and delicious. The only problem is we couldn't eat it all and this horrible hotel (ahem...Marriott) doesn't have a microwave for us to warm up the leftovers. It was still worth the price paid!

data.title: Primitive Delivery System, Undifferentiated Product
data.text: I've always been a fan of Pizza Hut, but I must say that they are really falling behind in the pizza industry, at least where I live in Dunwoody.  Places like Uncle Maddios and Your Pie offer customization akin to Chipotle or Moes, and whole wheat crust.  There was nothing premium about the premium pizza we ordered, and the website was down, so couldn't get the deal (which frustrated my wife) and the manager wouldn't give it to her by phone.  Finally, and this probably applies to just about all pizza delivery, not just Pizza Hut, in a world of Uber, Lyft, and GPS on smartphone, I am baffled that the drivers are given no tools to practice their trade.  We often don't order from Pizza Hut because getting the pizza to us is so difficult!!!  Odd that the Harvard MBA at headquarters hasn't figured out that solving that problem would really boost revenues!  Egad, I might even resort to Red Baron frozen over this!

data.title: Good stay in your room food
data.text: Ordered online, just a pizza. I had the timer up and there was a knock at the door in the final minute. Pizza was hot and good and right.

data.title: Pizza bargains
data.text: Pan pizza all the way.  Lots or weekly bargains as the pizza war continues in Atlanta.  Last week ANY large pizza for $10 - and a nice drive-up window on Buford Hwy.
